TI MAGNETIC, ELECTRICAL AND THERMAL-PROPERTIES OF HEAVY-FERMION
   SUPERCONDUCTOR UPD2AL3
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MAGNETICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5th European Magnetic Materials and Applications Conference (EMMA 93)
CY AUG 24-27, 1993
CL KOSICE, SLOVAKIA
SP P J SAFARIK UNIV, SLOVAK ACAD SCI KOSICE, INST EXPTL PHYS, CZECH ACAD SCI, INST PHYS
AB We report experimental results of electrical resistivity, de Haas-van Alphen effect, specific heat and thermal expansion of UPd2Al3. The nominal composition is denoted by the formula of UPd2+xAl3+y.    Samples with the composition of UPd2Al3.03 and UPd2.02Al3.03 reveal de Haas-van Alphen oscillations of the magnetic susceptibility. An anomaly is observed in the superconducting phase in the temperature dependence of the specific heat and thermal expansion of UPd2Al3.03. The relation between the sample quality and the appearance of the anomaly is discussed.

TI MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY AND HIGH-FIELD MAGNETIZATION PROCESS OF CECO5
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
ID RCO5 INTERMETALLICS
AB The magnetization process of single-crystalline CeCo5 has been measured at various temperatures from 4.2 to 300 K in high magnetic fields up to. 40 T. The uniaxial magnetocrystalline anisotropy constant K1 is found to be about 35% higher than that of YCo5. The magnetization anisotropy reaches p = 0.12 at 4.2 K, which is also higher than that of YCo5. Both the anisotropies decrease with increasing temperature. These experimental results indicate that Ce in CeCo5 is in a mixed-valence state.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
   CTR SOLID STATE PHYS,PL-31150 KRAKOW,POLAND.
   INST MET PHYS,SVERDLOVSK 620219,RUSSIA.

TI NUCLEAR MAGNETIC-RELAXATION IN THE ISING-LIKE ANTIFERROMAGNET CSCOCL3 -
   DOMAIN-WALL PAIRING IN THE 3D ORDERED PHASE
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID ONE-DIMENSIONAL ANTIFERROMAGNET; DYNAMICAL CORRELATION-FUNCTIONS;
   ANTI-FERROMAGNET CSCOCL3; ELECTRON-SPIN-RESONANCE; LINEAR-CHAIN; S=1/2
   ANTIFERROMAGNET; NEUTRON-SCATTERING; LATTICE RELAXATION; SOLITON PAIRS;
   CSCOBR3
AB The longitudinal relaxation time T1 and the transverse relaxation time T2 of Cs-133 NMR were measured in the three-dimensional ordered phase of a quasi-one-dimensional S = 1/2 Ising-like antiferromagnet CsCoCl3. The experimental results were well explained by a pulselike fluctuation due to spin inversion in the Co2+ chains. This fact strongly suggests the presence of domain-wall pairing in the linear chain. The spin-inversion rate, the spin-inversion duration, and the correlation time were evaluated from an analysis of fluctuating internal field at the Cs nuclei. The mechanism of the phase transition at T(N2) (9 K) was made clear from the dynamical point of view.

TI SOLUTION SPINNING OF THE HIGH-T(C) OXIDE SUPERCONDUCTOR .2. EFFECT OF
   ORGANIC-ACID ON THE COMPLEX-FORMATION OF PVA WITH THE COPPER(II) ION
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED POLYMER SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
ID FILAMENT
AB As basic research for the solution spinning of the high T(c) oxide superconductor, the effect of organic acid on the complex formation of poly(vinyl alcohol) (PVA) with the copper [Cu(II)] ion was explored with various carboxylic acids, such as formic acid, acetic acid, n-butylic acid, and lactic acid. The effects of these acids on the interaction between PVA and Cu (II) acetate in aqueous solution were nonexistent, while a chelation of the Cu(II) ion and lactic acid was detected. In the solid state, a linear complex of PVA with the Cu(II) ion was formed by adding organic acid. The ligand of the linear complex was highly dependent on the kind of acid used. (C) 1994 John Wiley & Sons, Inc.

TI FABRICATION OF NB-BASED JOSEPHSON-JUNCTIONS USING LOW-ENERGY ION-BEAM
   CLEANING
SO ELECTRONICS AND COMMUNICATIONS IN JAPAN PART II-ELECTRONICS
LA English
DT Article
DE NB-BASED SUPERCONDUCTING FILM; JOSEPHSON DEVICE; LOW-ENERGY ION BEAM;
   TUNNELING JUNCTION; ION ETCHING
AB Tunneling junction Josephson devices with an Nb/NbOx/Pb structure were fabricated using Nb-based superconducting films deposited by the biased-sputtering method. Prior to forming the junction, 100 to 400 eV low-energy Ar ion beam cleaning was employed instead of RF sputter-cleaning which has conventionally been used.
   An etching condition suitable for cleaning the junction was obtained experimentally by evaluating the relationship between the gap parameters obtained from the I-V characteristic and etching energy. It was found that since energy control was easy in ion beam cleaning, the etching could be carried out under optimum conditions. Also, when ion beam cleaning was used, the increase in the gap voltage and the current spikes in the I-V characteristic were much less than when RF sputter-cleaning was used. Using ion-beam etching under controlled energy, the junction could be cleaned with minimum damage, resulting in the improvement of the Josephson device properties.

AF GOTO, T
   UTSUGI, H
   WATANABE, K
TI EFFECT OF ATOMIC ORDER-DISORDER ON FE-57 HYPERFINE-STRUCTURE IN FE64PT36
   ALLOY
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
ID FE-PT; PERMANENT-MAGNETS; MOSSBAUER
AB X-ray, magnetic and Fe-57 Mossbauer effect measurements are made on 64 at.% Fe-Pt alloy during the transformation process from the face-centered cubic disordered gamma-phase to the CuAuI-type ordered gamma1-phase. This alloy is magnetically hard in the imperfectly ordered state of the gamma1-phase. The Mossbauer spectra show the following characteristic features: (1) Proceeding with atomic order, the spectrum splits gradually into two kinds of sextets which correspond to the Fe-57 atoms on the right sites of Fe and those on the right sites of Pt. (2) The value of the quadrupole shift is positive for the Fe site, and negative for the Pt site in the ordered state. (3) The line widths are asymmetric with respect to the center of the spectrum. These results can be explained well from a model based on the effect of atomic environment, in which the spatial disposition of atoms dominates the Fe-57 hyperfine structure of Fe-Pt alloys.

TI MORPHOLOGY AND PREFERRED ORIENTATION OF TITANIUM NITRIDE PLATES PREPARED
   BY CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO JOURNAL OF MATERIALS SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
ID TIN COATINGS; BEHAVIOR; CARBIDES
AB Thick titanium nitride (TiN(x); x = 0.74-1.0) plates (up to 2 mm thick) were prepared by chemical vapour deposition using TiCl4, NH3 and H-2 as source gases at a total gas pressure, P(tot), of 4 kPa, deposition temperatures, T(dep), from 1373 1873 K, and NH3/TiCl4, m(N/Ti), gas molar ratio from 0.17-1.74. The effects of deposition conditions on morphology, preferred orientation and composition of CVD-TiN(x) plates were investigated. Surface morphology changed from faceted to nodular texture with increasing m(N/Ti) and T(dep). The faceted and nodular deposits showed columnar and shell-like fracture cross-sections, respectively. The composition (x = N/Ti) increased with increasing m(N/Ti) and T(dep) below m(N/Ti) = 1.0, and was constant above m(N/Ti) = 1.0. Three kinds of preferred orientations were observed: (100) orientation-at low T(dep), (110) orientation at intermediate T(dep) and low m(N/Ti), and (111) orientation at high T(dep) and high m(N/Ti). This tendency is discussed thermodynamically, and explained as being due to changes in the degree of supersaturation in the gas phase.

TI INFINITE-LAYER OF SOLUTION-SPUN (CA1-XSRX)YCUO2-Z FILAMENTS
SO JOURNAL OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
LA English
DT Article
DE INFINITE LAYER; CA-SR-CU-O; SOLUTION SPINNING; AMBIENT PRESSURE;
   FILAMENTS
AB The direct synthesis of infinite-layer (Ca1-xSrx)0.9CuO2-z (x = 0.14, 0.2, 0.25, 0.3) in filaments by solution spinning under ambient pressure was studied. The filaments were spun by dry-spinning with a starting aqueous solution containing acetates of Ca, Sr, and Cu, poly(vinyl alcohol), and organic acids. A single phase of the infinite layer appeared for the filament with x = 0.14 and 0.2 and a mixed phase of the infinite layer and SrCuO2 for the other compositions. The solution spinning lowered the synthesis temperature of the infinite layer by 150-degrees-C in spite of the narrow synthesis conditions. However, no indication of superconductivity at greater than 4.2 K was observed.

TI QUADRUPOLE-STRAIN INTERACTION IN RARE-EARTH HEXABORIDES
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE QUADRUPOLE-STRAIN INTERACTION; RARE EARTH HEXABORIDES; ULTRASOUND;
   QUADRUPOLAR MOMENT; QUADRUPOLAR RESPONSE; DENSE KONDO EFFECT; VALENCE
   FLUCTUATION
ID MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; SINGLE-CRYSTALS; PRB6; CEB6; EXCITATIONS;
   CEXLA1-XB6; SYSTEMS; NDB6
AB Temperature dependence of the elastic constants in a series of rare earth hexaborides has been investigated by means of the ultrasonic method. The remarkable softening of the transverse C44 mode in PrB6, NdB6, DyB6 and HoB6 has been discussed in connection with the cooperative Jahn-Teller effect due to the CEF ground state degenerated by the quadrupolar moment. The low temperature behavior of C44 in CexLa1-xB6 compounds is presented to show the Kondo effect on the quadrupolar moment of GAMMA8 ground state. The anomaly of the bulk modulus C(B) in SMB6 is related to the valence fluctuation state in the system.

TI EVALUATION OF NOISE INCREASE DUE TO PUMP LIGHT CROSSTALK IN QUADRATURE
   SQUEEZED-LIGHT GENERATION WITH A FIBER RING REFLECTOR
SO OPTICS AND LASER TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
DE SQUEEZED LIGHT; HOMODYNE DETECTORS; FIBER COUPLERS; FIBER RING
   REFLECTORS
ID STATES; PULSES
AB In generating quadrature squeezed light with a fibre ring reflector, the pump light crosstalk should be minimized to achieve the sub-shot noise levels. The output noise of the homodyne detector, whose signal light is the squeezed light with non-zero amplitude, is analysed theoretically and experimentally for the first time. The requirement for the fibre coupler to generate the squeezed light is derived.
C1 FUJITSU LABS LTD,DIV TRANSMISS,KAWASAKI,KANAGAWA 211,JAPAN.

TI FINE Y-BA-CU-O FILAMENT PRODUCED BY SOLUTION SPINNING METHOD
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB Preparation of fine Y-Ba-Cu-O superconducting filament by solution spinning method was examined.  A high transport Jc more than 1000 A/cm2 at 77 K and 0 T was attained for the sintered filament with more than 26 mum in diameter by starting the precursor filament with more than 110 mum in diameter. By controlling the melt-growth process of  the filament, dense and highly oriented textures, were produced and a maximum Jc of 15000 A/cm2 and 9800 A/cm2 at 77 K and 0 T was attained for the filament in diameter of 35 mum and 20 mum, respectively.

TI MAGNETIC PHASE-TRANSITION IN LA2-XSRXCUO4 AROUND X=0.115 STUDIED BY
   LA-NMR
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB The copper oxide superconductor La2-xSrxCuO4 shows x-T(C) curve with a small dip at x=0.115. In order to investigate the origin of this kink, the temperature dependence of La-139-NMR spectra has been studied. The significant broadening in the spectra was observed below 30K, suggesting the existence of the antiferromagnetic phase transition around x=0.115.

TI LA-139-NMR STUDY ON LA2-XBAXCUO4 AROUND X-SIMILAR-OR-EQUAL-TO-0.125
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB The temperature dependence of La-139-NMR spectra has been studied on the copper oxide superconductor La2-xBaxCuO4 around x congruent-to 0.125, at which the superconductivity is anomalously suppressed. The significant broadening in resonance lines was observed below 35K, suggesting the antiferromagnetic phase transition of Cu 3d-spins. The analysis of the spectra has revealed that the internal field at La site is approximately 170 Oe, perpendicular to c-axis.

TI CU/TL-NMR STUDY ON TL-BASED ANTIFERROMAGNETIC COPPER-OXIDE TLBA2YCU2O7
   (TL-1212)
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB Zero-field spectra of the antiferromagnetic Cu-NMR have been observed on the Tl-based copper oxide TlBa2YCu2O7 (Tl1212). The internal field and the electric field gradient at Cu site have been found to be comparable to other antiferromagnetic phase of high-T(c) oxides. Hyperfine coupling constants of both Cu and Tl sites have been obtained through the analysis of Tl and Cu spectra.

TI SYNTHESES AND NMR-STUDY OF 4F-SPIN-FREE ELECTRON-DOPED COPPER OXIDES
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB All the electron-doped high-T(c) oxides discovered so far inevitably contain lanthanides, whose 4f-spin fluctuation hides all the NMR information on the superconductivity. The new copper oxide superconductor (La1-yYy)2-xCexCuO4 with T'-type structure, which is free from 4f-spins has been successfully synthesized. Obtained compounds showed a nearly zero electric field gradient(EFG) at Cu site, which demonstrates that the doped carrier is electronic.

TI THRESHOLD CORRECTION ON GAUGINO MASSES AT GRAND-UNIFICATION SCALE
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW D
LA English
DT Article
ID SOFTLY BROKEN SUPERSYMMETRY; UNIFIED THEORIES; PROTON DECAY; MODELS;
   ELECTROWEAK; BREAKING; SU(5); PARAMETERS; GUTS
AB We calculate the threshold correction on gaugino masses of the SU(3) x SU(2) x U(1) gauge group at the grand-unification scale in SU(5) supersymmetric (SUSY) grand unified theory (GUT). This depends on the content of the heavy chiral multiplets and the pattern of their soft SUSY-breaking mass parameters. We show that in the minimal SU(5) SUSY GUT the correction to the GUT relation of the gaugino masses is very small as long as all the soft SUSY-breaking mass parameters are of the same order of magnitude. Also, we discuss the correction of the GUT relation of the gaugino masses in the nonminimal models and show that the GUT relation of the gaugino masses can be broken only in some special circumstances.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST COSM RAY RES,TANASHI,TOKYO 188,JAPAN.
RP HISANO, J (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI 980,JAPAN.

TI SYNTHESIS AND CHARACTERIZATION OF SOLUBLE POLYMER LIGANDS POSSESSING
   SULFIDE SIDE-CHAINS
SO REACTIVE POLYMERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SOLUBLE POLYMER LIGAND; SULFIDE SIDE CHAIN; BINDING ABILITY;
   ANTIBACTERIAL ACTIVITY; COOPERATIVE INTERACTION
ID POLYTHIOETHERS; THIOETHERS
AB Soluble polymer ligands possessing aryl monosulfide side chains [poly(4-vinylphenylmethyl sulfide) (PVPMS)], alkyl monosulfide side chains [poly(4-vinylbenzylmethyl sulfide) (PVBMS)] and branched tetrasulfide side chains [poly(7-(4-vinylbenzyloxy)-2,5,9,12-tetrathiatridecane) (PTeSSD)] were prepared by radical polymerization of the corresponding monomers. These polymer ligands had specific binding abilities for soft acids only, such as Ag(I) and Hg(II) ions. The tetrasulfide-type polymer ligand, PTeSSD, bound the metal ion only by the tetrasulfide side chain itself. The monosulfide-type polymer ligands, PVPMS and PVBMS, bound the metal ion by co-operative interaction between their monosulfide side chains. The resulting polymer-Ag(I) complexes were soluble in organic solvents. Interestingly, a polyester cloth coated with the polymer-Ag(I) complex exhibited significant antibacterial activity against Staphylococcus aureus.
C1 NAGOYA INST TECHNOL,DEPT APPL CHEM,GOKISOCHO,SHOWA KU,NAGOYA,AICHI 466,JAPAN.

TI SQUEEZED-LIGHT GENERATION WITH 1.064 MU-M ND-YAG LASER AND 0.85 MU-M
   SINGLE-MODE FIBER
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SQUEEZED LIGHT; OPTICAL KERR EFFECT; FIBER RING REFLECTOR; FIBER
   COUPLER; BALANCED HOMODYNE DETECTION
ID WAVE BRILLOUIN-SCATTERING; OPTICAL PULSES; NOISE; INTERFEROMETER; STATES
AB Efficient squeezing at low pump light power is demonstrated with a mode-locked 1.064 mu m Nd:YAG laser and a fiber ring reflector made of 0.85 mu m single-mode fiber. Noise reduction of about 2.0 dB below the shot noise level is observed. The squeezing process by the optical Kerr effect is calculated with a simple model. The experimental results are in good agreement with the calculated ones.
C1 FUJITSU LABS LTD,DIV LIGHTWAVE TECHNOL DEV,KAWASAKI,KANAGAWA 211,JAPAN.
RP NISHIZAWA, N (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,DEPT QUANTUM ENGN,NAGOYA,AICHI 46101,JAPAN.

TI PICOSECOND DYNAMICS OF CONFINED EXCITONS AND THEIR OPTICAL
   NONLINEARITIES IN CUCL NANOCRYSTALS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
DE SEMICONDUCTOR QUANTUM DOTS; OPTICAL NONLINEARITY; PICOSECOND DYNAMICS;
   EXCITON; CUCL
ID RADIATIVE DECAY; QUANTUM DOTS; MICROCRYSTALS; SIZE; MATRICES
AB Optical nonlinearities in confined exciton system were investigated in CuCl nanocrystats embedded in NaCl matrices at 77 K with use of ns and sub-ps laser excitations. Size-dependent excitation photon density necessary for the saturation of the exciton absorption peak under the ns excitation at the exciton resonance showed that the number of excitons per one nanocrystal governs the magnitude of the saturation regardless of the crystal size. Transient absorption change measured under sub-ps band-to-band excitation revealed the strong correlation between the temporal response of the excitonic optical nonlinearities and the formation and decay dynamics of the exciton and biexciton systems in CuCl nanocrystals.

TI ELECTRON DYNAMICS IN CDSE MICROCRYSTALLITES IN POROUS-GLASS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
DE ELECTRON DYNAMICS; MICROCRYSTALLITE; CDSE; LUMINESCENCE DECAY
AB We embedded CdSe nanocrstallites into a porous glass with a diffusion process. Using picosecond time resolved luminescence spectrum technique, we investigated the electron dynamics in the CdSe microcrystallites in porous glass. The luminescence decay of our sample has a fast component decay sensitive to temperature. For a sample of CdSe microcrystallites with an average size of 25 Angstrom diameter, the fast decay is 50 ps at 77 K, and is 100 ps at 2 K. With a simple three level model, the luminescence decay is simulated. The temperature dependence of luminescence decay results from nonradiative process.
RP IKEMOTO, Y (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
CR BAWENDI MG, 1992, J CHEM PHYS, V96, P96

TI OPTICAL-PROPERTIES AND ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURES OF SELF-ORGANIZED
   QUANTUM-WELL (CNH2N+1NH3)(2)PBX(4) (X=I, BR, CL)
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
DE CATIONIC EXCITON; CHARGE TRANSFER EXCITON; 2-DIMENSION; LAYERED
   PEROVSKITE; TIGHT BINDING BAND CALCULATION
ID SEMICONDUCTORS
AB We observed a prominent absorption peak due to the lowest exciton state in the two-dimensional perovskite crystals at 2.55eV for (C10H21NH3)(2)PbI4, 3.17eV for (C1OH21NH3)(2)PbBr4, and 3.75eV for (C10H21NH3)(2)PbCl4, respectively. The less prominent structures in the absorption spectrum above the fewest exciton shifts as a whole, as the halogen goes from I to Cl, which shows that the optical excitation in these compounds is not due to the intraatomic transition in the Pb atom (cationic transition) but due to the interatomic transition from the halogen atom to the Pb atom. We performed tight binding calculations of the electronic band structure, which explain the energy shift and the polarization dependence of the reflection spectra.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RP ISHIHARA, T (reprint author), HIROSHIMA UNIV,DEPT PHYS ELECTR,HIGASHIHIROSHIMA 724,JAPAN.

TI NONLINEAR-OPTICAL SPECTRA OF THE CONFINED EXCITONS IN STRESS-INDUCED
   NANOSTRUCTURES IN BII3
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
DE NANOSTRUCTURE; CONFINED EXCITON; QUANTUM DISK; OPTICAL NONLINEARITY;
   ABSORPTION SATURATION; INELASTIC RECOILING OF EXCITON; NONLINEAR
   LUMINESCENCE; ULTRAFAST PHENOMENA
AB We report the optical nonlinear response of the confined excitons in nanostructures induced by external stress in a layered crystal BiI3. The absorption intensity of the confined excitons is saturated by intense laser excitation. We clarify the size dependence of the saturation density which reflects the nanostructure size. The saturation density of the confined exciton in large domains is lower than the the case of small domains. By pump-probe measurements using a sub-picosecond laser pulse, we examine the dynamical process of the confined excitons in the disks with various sizes. From the temporal behavior of the absorption saturation, it becomes clear that the exciton life times in small disks are shorter than the large ones. A new nonlinearly growing luminescence due to the process by a inelastic recoiling of excitons is detected.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 98077,JAPAN.
   TOHOKU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 98077,JAPAN.

TI NONLINEAR-OPTICAL PROPERTIES OF CDTE MICROCRYSTALLITES IN CAF2 THIN-FILM
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
DE MICROCRYSTALLITE; CDTE; NONLINEAR OPTICAL PROPERTY
ID SEMICONDUCTOR MICROCRYSTALS
AB The nonlinear optical properties of CdTe microcrystallites embedded in CaF2 by pulsed laser beam and electron beam coevaporation method are investigated with pump-probe technique. Only bleaching effect around wavelength region corresponding to the larger size microcrystallites can be obtained. The bleaching spectra are simulated with a state filling model. The upper energy states of the quantum confinement microcrystallites are perhaps also important to the nonlinear optical properties of microcrystallites.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,SCI MEASUREMENTS RES INST,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI SUBPICOSECOND SPECTROSCOPY OF CUCL NANOCRYSTALS IN NACL
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
ID MICROCRYSTALLITES; SIZE
AB In CuCl nanocrystals, we observed the nonlinear change in the exciton absorption spectra and the appearance of the structures (gain and loss) near the energy region of biexciton luminescence band using the subpicosecond pump-and-probe method under high intensity excitation at 2K and 77K. We observed the decay time of the exciton absorption change at 2K to be about 1ns, twice as large as that at 77K. We found out that the peak positions of the gain and the loss differed in energy at 2K, while they had the same energy at 77K. Taking into account of the luminescence and their time behavior, we got the evidence that the transitions from the biexciton state to ''bound'' and ''free'' exciton states occur simultaneously at 2K.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 98077,JAPAN.

TI EXCITON DYNAMICS OF POLY(DI-N-HEXYLSILANE) FILM
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
DE POLY(DI-N-HEXYLSILANE); PHOTOLUMINESCENCE; TIME-RESOLVED LUMINESCENCE;
   POLYMER; EXCITON; SELECTIVE EXCITATION
AB We have measured excitation spectra of exciton luminescence and time response of a a-conjugated one-dimensional polymer, poly(di-n-hexylsilane), film at 2K. The site selective luminescence neat 3.36 eV is measured under the excitation of light with energy lower than 3.528 eV. The time-resolved spectra of the luminescence show that the peak energy of 3.369 eV shifts to 3.360 eV within 360 picoseconds. The site-selective luminescence and the peak shift in the picosecond time region are discussed in terms of the disordered segment model.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,INST CHEM REACT SCI,SENDAI,MIYAGI 98077,JAPAN.

TI SIZE-DEPENDENT EXCITON DENSITIES OF STATES AND EXCITON BANDWIDTHS IN
   ANTHRACENE MICROCRYSTALLITES
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd Nishina International Conference on Optical Properties of
   Nanostructures
CY SEP 19-22, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP INOUE SCI FDN, SENDAI, IZUMI SCI & TECHNOL FDN
HO SENDAI INT CTR
DE EXCITON DENSITY OF SLATES; EXCITON BANDWIDTH; ANTHRACENE
   MICROCRYSTALLITES
AB Applying a technique to determine the k = 0 components in the exciton densities of sates (DOS) we found:
   (1) The DOS in anthracene microcrystallites appears as sharp bands followed by broad tails extended towards higher energies.
   (2) The exciton bandwidth which depends linearly on the size of microcrystallites where the diameter is smaller than 60 Angstrom.
   (3) The bandwidth takes its maximum value 340 cm(-1) for microcrystallite of 65 Angstrom.
   (4) For larger microcrystallites, the bandwidth decreases asymptotically to 300 cm(-1)
   (5) This width 300 cm(-1) is equivalent to the bandwidth for bulk crystal.
   (6) Exciton scattering at the surface of microcrystallites is extremely effective.

TI EFFECTS OF CO3(2)-ION ON THE FORMATION OF OCTACALCIUM PHOSPHATE AT PH
   7.4 AND 37-DEGREES-C
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article
ID ENAMEL FORMATION; CARBONATED APATITES; CALCIUM-PHOSPHATE; PRECIPITATION;
   TEMPERATURE; MORPHOLOGY; CRYSTALS; GROWTH
AB The effects of carbonate (CO32-) ion on the formation of octacalcium phosphate (OCP) were studied at pH 7.4 and 37-degrees-C.  The reaction was carried out in solutions with various amounts of KHCO3 (0 20mM) and with an initial solution Ca/P ratio of 0.075-0.25. CO32- ion changes the OCP/apatite ratio of the product, depending upon the Ca/P ratio of the solution, that is, with the increase in CO3 concentration, the amount of OCP increases and then decreases, while the amount of apatite decreases and then increases: when the Ca/P of the solution is high, a smaller amount of CO32- ion disturbs the crystal growth of OCP.  The morphology of the products is plate-like under various amounts CO3, but the thickness decreases and the crystal size becomes small with increasing CO3 concentration. These results indicate thal CO32- ion significantly affects the product and morphology of final crystals. Possible roles of CO32- ion in the biological crystallization are discussed.
RP IIJIMA, M (reprint author), ASAHI UNIV,SCH DENT,1851-1 HOZUMI,HOZUMI CHO,MOTOSU,GIFU 50102,JAPAN.

TI RESONANT RAMAN-SCATTERING OF PBI2 MICROCRYSTALLITES IN E-MAA COPOLYMER
SO JOURNAL OF LUMINESCENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9th International Conference on Dynamical Processes in Excited States of
   Solids (DPC 93)
CY AUG 02-06, 1993
CL CAMBRIDGE, MA
SP USN, OFF NAVAL RES, SPECTRA PHYS INC, COHERENT INC, AMER PHYS SOC, OPT SOC AMER
HO MIT
AB Resonant Raman scattering of PbI2 microcrystallites has been measured at 77 K. When the excitation energy is in the region of the exciton absorption bands, there appear two new Raman lines with energies 105 and 122 cm-1. The 105 cm-1 line is assigned to a surface phonon mode.

TI OPTICAL GAIN IN AN INHOMOGENEOUSLY BROADENED EXCITON SYSTEM
SO JOURNAL OF LUMINESCENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9th International Conference on Dynamical Processes in Excited States of
   Solids (DPC 93)
CY AUG 02-06, 1993
CL CAMBRIDGE, MA
SP USN, OFF NAVAL RES, SPECTRA PHYS INC, COHERENT INC, AMER PHYS SOC, OPT SOC AMER
HO MIT
ID LASER-DIODES; GREEN
AB Optical gain spectra are investigated for Zn0.7Cd0.3Se/ZnSe single quantum well laser structures at room temperature by varying the optical excitation length. An optical gain of several tens of cm-1 is achieved for 100 kW/cm2 at the exciton tail region. The photoluminescence excitation spectrum is also measured to determine exciton resonances. The gain mechanism is discussed in terms of phase-space filling of an inhomogeneously broadened exciton state.

TI ITINERANT METAMAGNETISM OF THE CO-SUBLATTICE IN THE Y1-XNDXCO3 SYSTEM IN
   ULTRAHIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS UP TO 110-T
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article
ID TRANSITION; YCO3
AB Magnetization measurements have been carried out for Y1-xNdxCo3 compounds with 0 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 1 in ultrahigh magnetic fields up to 110 T. The compound exhibits two metamagnetic transitions of the Co sublattice to a higher moment state. Both transition fields decrease with increasing Nd concentration due to the exchange field from the Nd sublattice acting on the Co sublattice. From the concentration dependence of the transition fields the average exchange parameter between Nd and Co is estimated to be J(NdCo) = 2.0 x 10(-22) J. The spontaneous Co moment and the Curie temperature also exhibit an anomalous increase with Nd concentration, which originates from the transitions.

TI EXCITON STUDY IN PBI2 MICROCRYSTALLITES BY PUMP-PROBE METHOD
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID QUANTUM
AB A change in the absorption spectrum due to excitons of PbI2 microcrystallites embedded into E-MAA copolymer by the laser light irradiation have been measured by a pump and probe method in the temperature range from 2 to 77 K. A hole is observed in the exciton bands in the one, two and three layer crystallites. This hole is interpreted as due to temperature rise of the microcrystallites by the laser light. The homogeneous broadening of the exciton band estimated from the hole width is considered to originate from the defect or impurity scattering below 40 K and from the phonon scattering above 40 K.

TI VIBRATIONAL-MODES OF C-60 FULLERENE ON SI(100)2X1 SURFACE
SO JOURNAL OF ELECTRON SPECTROSCOPY AND RELATED PHENOMENA
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th International Conference on Vibration of Surfaces
CY JUN 14-17, 1993
CL GENOA, ITALY
AB We have measured coverage and scattering angle dependences on the electron energy loss by vibrational excitations of C-60 on the Si(100)2x1 surface using a high-resolution spectrometer. If C-60 is evaporated 5 Angstrom (approximately half a monolayer) on Si(100), a strong energy loss peak appears at 65 meV, and weak peaks and shoulders at 72, 144, and 175 meV. In the 12 Angstrom thick film, additional weak peaks at 96, 160, and 189 meV become more apparent. Intensities of these peaks are comparable to those of thick films measured by infra-red absorption and by Raman scattering spectroscopies. These results suggest appreciable interactions between C-60 and the dangling bonds of Si surface.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,SENDAI 980,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF NDCO3 AND ITS GAMMA-PHASE HYDRIDE NDCO3H4.1
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
ID CO COMPOUNDS
AB Magnetization measurements have been carried out for an aligned powder sample of NdCo3 and for an isotropic sample of the hydride NdCo3H4.1. NdCo3 is a ferromagnet with T(c) = 381 K and exhibits a spin reorientation transition of easy direction from the basal plane to the c axis in the temperature range 220-255 K. NdCo3 shows a field-induced phase transition in low fields below 0.7 T along the c axis from the collinear to non-collinear structure at temperatures below 115 K. NdCo3H4.1 is an anti-ferromagnet with T(N) = 214 K and exhibits a metamagnetic transition to the ferromagnetic structure in applied magnetic fields. The transition field of NdCo3H4.1 is significantly decreased compared with the hydride with non-magnetic Y instead of Nd by the positive exchange field acting on the Co sublattice from the Nd sublattice.

TI MAGNETIC PHASE-TRANSITIONS IN GD3CO
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERMETALLIC COMPOUNDS; R3CO
AB Magnetization, electrical resistivity, thermal expansion, magnetostriction and sound velocity were measured for Gd3Co single crystals. The compound has an orthorhombic Fe3C-type crystal structure and exhibits an antiferromagnetic arrangement of Gd magnetic moments below TN = 131 K. First-order phase transitions from the antiferromagnetic to the forced ferromagnetic state are observed along the b and c axes at a critical field H(c) almost-equal-to 0.8 T. Along the a axis, Gd3Co also becomes a forced ferromagnet at approximately 1.5 T, but the magnetization process occurs by the rotation of Gd magnetic moments. An antiferromagnetic ordering of the Co sublattice appears below T* = 3.7 K Anisotropy of the electrical resistivity is found below T(N). The field-induced antiferromagnetic to ferromagnetic transitions are accompanied by large magnetoresistance (DELTArho/rho0 almost-equal-to -50%) and magnetostriction (DELTAl/l almost-equal-to 3.8 x 10(-4)) as well as by a large change of the sound velocity of the shear wave in the bc plane (from 675 m s-1 down to 220 m s-1). Magnetic phase diagrams of Gd3Co are given for different directions of the applied field.

TI EFFECT OF RARE-GAS DILUTION ON CH3 RADICAL DENSITY IN RF-DISCHARGE CH4
   PLASMA
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE CH3 RADICAL DENSITY; EXCITED XE-ASTERISK; RF-DISCHARGE CH4/RARE GAS
   PLASMA; INFRARED DIODE LASER ABSORPTION SPECTROSCOPY (IRLAS)
ID FREQUENCY PLASMAS; DIODE-LASER
AB The behavior of the CH3 radical density in a parallel-plate RF CH4 Plasma diluted with rare gases (He, Ne, Ar, Kr, and Xe) was investigated systematically using infrared diode laser absorption spectroscopy. The CH3 radical density increased in CH4/Xe and CH4/Kr plasmas with increasing rare gas dilution. The Xe* atom densities in the lowest metastable state P-3(2) and the resonant state  P-3(1) were measured in CH4/Xe plasma through absorption spectroscopy using a Xe hollow cathode lamp in order to clarify the role of Xe* (P-3(2) and P-3(1)) atoms. It was shown that the increase in the CH3 radical density in CH4/Xe plasma was mainly caused by the collision of Xe* atoms with CH4 molecules.

TI DEPOSITION RATES OF TITANIUM NITRIDE PLATES PREPARED BY
   CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION OF TICL4+NH3 SYSTEM
SO JOURNAL OF MATERIALS SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
AB Titanium nitride plates (TiN(x), x = 0.74-1.0, about 2 mm thick maximum) were prepared by chemical vapour deposition (CVD) using TiCl4, NH3 and H-2 as source gases. The effects of CVD conditions, i.e. gas molar ratio (m(N/Ti) = NH3/TiCl4) and deposition temperature (T(dep)), on deposition rates and surface morphology were examined, and the deposition mechanism of the CVD-TiN(x) plates was discussed. The relationship between m(N/Ti) and deposition rates showed a maximum peak at certain m(N/Ti), and this maximum peak shifted to lower m(N/Ti) with increasing T(dep). The activation energy for the formation of CVD-TiN(x) plates was about 80 kJ mol-1 in the lower temperature range. The decomposition reaction of NH3 gas  could be associated with the rate-controlling step. At higher temperatures, the diffusion process may be the rate-controlling step, and a large amount of powder (mainly NH4Cl) was formed in the gas phase. The highest deposition rate obtained in the present work was 1.06 x 10(-7) ms-1 (0.38 mm h-1) at T(dep) = 1773 K and m(N/Ti) = 0.87.

AF KATAOKA, M
   GOTO, T
TI THEORY OF THE ACOUSTIC DE-HAAS-VAN-ALPHEN EFFECT
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE ACOUSTIC DE-HAAS-VAN-ALPHEN EFFECT; LANDAU LEVEL; MAGNETOSTRICTION;
   ELASTIC CONSTANT; DEFORMATION POTENTIAL; FERMI SURFACE; ROTATION EFFECT
ID ROTATIONAL INVARIANCE
AB The de Haas-van Alphen (dHvA) oscillations of the magnetostrictions and the elastic constants are investigated theoretically. The electron band with orthorhombic symmetry is treated in the effective mass approximation. For omega(s)tau << 1 with the sound-wave angular frequency omega(s) and the electron life time tau, Landau orbitals are formed in a deformed metal without affecting local ion motions. In this static approximation to the ion motion, the free energy of the electron-lattice system is calculated as a function of strains. This free energy reveals the acoustic dHvA oscillations and proves that their amplitudes strongly depend on both the direction of an applied magnetic field and the strain mode. It is emphasized that the present acoustic dHvA effect can be a good probe into the electronic properties of metals such as the Fermi surface and the electron-lattice coupling.

TI VIBRATIONAL-MODES OF C60 FULLERENE ADSORBED ON SI(100)2X1 SURFACE
   STUDIED BY HIGH-RESOLUTION ELECTRON-ENERGY-LOSS SPECTROSCOPY
SO SCIENCE REPORTS OF THE RESEARCH INSTITUTES TOHOKU UNIVERSITY SERIES
   A-PHYSICS CHEMISTRY AND METALLURGY
LA English
DT Article
DE C60; FULLERENE; HREELS; VIBRATIONAL MODE; SI(100)2X1 SURFACE
AB We have measured the inelastic electron-energy-loss spectra of C60 on the Si(100)2x1 surface in the infra-red energy range. If C60 is evaporated 5 angstrom (approximately half a monolayer) on Si(100), a strong energy loss peak appears at 65 meV, and weak peaks and shoulders at 72, 144, and 175 meV. In the 12 angstrom thick film, additional weak peaks at 96, 160, and 189 meV become more apparent. Intensities of these peaks are comparable to those of thick films measured by infra-red absorption and by Raman scattering spectroscopies. Moreover, we have measured the angle dependence of the inelastic electron intensity. These results suggest appreciable interactions between C60 and the dangling bonds of Si surface.

TI OPTICAL-PROPERTIES OF CDTE MICROCRYSTALLITES IN CAF2
SO SCIENCE REPORTS OF THE RESEARCH INSTITUTES TOHOKU UNIVERSITY SERIES
   A-PHYSICS CHEMISTRY AND METALLURGY
LA English
DT Article
DE MICROCRYSTALLITE; CDTE; CAF2; OPTICAL PROPERTIES
ID SEMICONDUCTOR QUANTUM DOTS; RAMAN-SCATTERING; DOPED GLASSES; SIZE; CDSE;
   CRYSTALLITES; NONLINEARITY; ELECTRON; DYNAMICS; CLUSTERS
AB Using pulsed laser beam and electron beam coevaporation method, we have embedded CdTe microcrystallites into CaF2 thin film in a highly based vacuum chamber. Nanometer scale CdTe particles are observed in the thin film with transmission electron micrographs. The blue shifts of the absorption bands and the corresponding shifts of photoluminescence bands are obtained. And the broadened optical phonon Raman structure and low wave number acousmic phonon structure are also obtained. These results are considered to be size effect of the CdTe microcrystallites.

TI DYNAMIC-MODE FORCE MICROSCOPY FOR THE DETECTION OF LATERAL AND VERTICAL
   ELECTROSTATIC FORCES
SO APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID MAGNETIZATION; POTENTIOMETRY; SCALE
AB In this letter, a variant of scanning force microscope for detecting attractive forces is reported. The force gradients of the attractive forces acting in two orthogonal directions were detected simultaneously from the resonant frequency shifts of a cantilever oscillating in two directions. Using the fine electrode sample, the distributions of the electrostatic forces acting in lateral and vertical directions were visualized separately.

TI PREPARATION OF SIC-W2C NANO-COMPOSITE POWDERS BY
   CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION OF THE SIH4-CH4-WF6-H2 SYSTEM
SO JOURNAL OF MATERIALS SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
ID INFRARED-ABSORPTION
AB SiC-W2C composite powders were prepared by chemical vapour deposition (CVD) using SiH4 + CH4 + WF6 + H-2 as source gases at a temperature of 1673 K. X-ray diffraction, TEM observation and infrared absorption were used to characterize the structures of the powders. The prepared powders consisted of SiC-W2C composite particles and hollow beta-SiC particles. The SiC-W2C composite particles had a W2C core and an SiC shell. The average particle diameters of the SiC-W2C composite and hollow SiC particles increased from 18 to 30 nm and from 40 to 70 nm, respectively, with an increase of SiH4 concentration. TEM and infrared spectrum analyses showed that the W2C core diameter was unchanged (about 18 nm), while the SiC shell thickness varied from 1 to 6 nm with reaction conditions.
RP CHEN, LD (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,KATAHIRA 2-1-1,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RI GOTO, TAKASHI/C-2470-2011

TI OPTICAL-PROPERTIES OF POTASSIUM CLUSTERS INCORPORATED INTO ZEOLITE LTA
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID SMALL METAL-CLUSTERS; ELECTRON-SPIN-RESONANCE; SODIUM CLUSTERS;
   ABSORPTION-SPECTRUM; CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE; ALKALI-METALS; CLOSED-SHELL;
   PHOTOABSORPTION; MICROCLUSTERS; EXCITATION
AB Optical properties are reported for cationic K clusters incorporated into the a cage of K-form LTA. The a cage has an inside diameter of approximately 11 angstrom and is arrayed in a simple cubic structure. The loading density of potassium is systematically changed from dilute to saturated conditions. The average number of pest K atoms is 7.3 per alpha cage at the saturation density. Three groups of absorption and/or reflection bands appear depending on the K loading density. A band at approximately 2 eV increases and becomes the strongest reflection band with increasing K density, and is assigned to the surface-plasmon-like state of the K cluster. Other groups of bands are relatively weak and are interpreted in terms of the model of the transition between energy bands which originate from 1s, 1p, and 1d molecular orbitals of the K cluster. A Drude-like contribution is found in the analysis of reflection spectra. This is reminiscent of the metallic state of arrayed clusters.
RP KODAIRA, T (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI FERROMAGNETIC PROPERTIES OF POTASSIUM CLUSTERS INCORPORATED INTO ZEOLITE
   LTA
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID ITINERANT ELECTRON FERROMAGNETISM; U=INFINITY HUBBARD-MODEL;
   STRONG-CORRELATION LIMIT; LOW DC-FIELDS; METALLIC CLUSTERS;
   TRANSITION-METALS; MAGNETIC-SUSCEPTIBILITY; SPIN FLUCTUATIONS;
   GUTZWILLER METHOD; MONTE-CARLO
AB Ferromagnetic properties are reported for K clusters incorporated into the alpha cage (supercage) of zeolite LTA. In LTA, alpha cages are arrayed in a simple cubic structure with a lattice constant of 12.3 angstrom. The average 4s-electron number per cluster, n, is systematically changed from 0.8 to 7.3 by controlling the K loading density. Ferromagnetism is observed for 2 - 3 < n < 6- 7. The magnetization shows a peak at n approximately 5, and the average magnetic moment amounts to 0. 24 mu(B) per cluster at 100 Oe and 1.7 K. The Curie temperature is n dependent and less than 7 K. Magnetic properties are basically interpreted in terms of the model of itinerant electron ferromagnetism. Narrow energy bands due to the electron transfer between adjacent clusters play an important role in the construction of a model. The magnetic properties exhibit spin-glass and reentrant spin-glass phenomena depending on the K loading density.
RP NOZUE, Y (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI MEASUREMENT OF DIFFUSION-COEFFICIENTS FOR GROUND-STATE AND METASTABLE
   COPPER ATOMS IN RARE-GASES
SO JOURNAL OF PHYSICS D-APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
AB The diffusion coefficients for ground-state (S-2(1/2)) copper atoms in He, Ne and Ar and those for metastable (2D3/2) copper atoms in Ne and Ar were determined experimentally. By producing copper vapour in a low-power hollow cathode discharge, measurements were performed near room temperature. The diffusion coefficients for Cu(2D3/2) were found to be approximately equal to the corresponding quantities for Cu(S-2(1/2)).
RP SEKIDO, H (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,DEPT INFORMAT ELECTR,CHIKUSA KU,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI PREPARATION OF BA2NANB5O15 FILM BY RF MAGNETRON SPUTTERING METHOD
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 10TH MEETING OF FERROELECTRIC MATERIALS AND THEIR APPLICATIONS ( FMA-10
   )
CY MAY 26-28, 1993
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
DE TUNGSTEN-BRONZE STRUCTURE; BA2NANB5O15; FERROELECTRIC; RF MAGNETRON
   SPUTTERING; PT ELECTRODE; FILM THICKNESS; ORTHORHOMBIC-TETRAGONAL PHASE
   TRANSITION
AB A film with tungsten-bronze structure was formed on a Pt/Al2O3 substrate by a RF msagnetron sputtering method. The deposition ratio of the films (Ba:Na:Nb) depended on the sputtering gas pressure. When the deposition rates were 10 nm/min at 10(-1) Pa and 5 nm/min at 8 Pa, the dielectric constant and the dielectric loss factor were 141 and 0.02 at room temperature, respectively, and the remanent polarization P(r) and the coercive field E(c) were 32 muC/cm2 and 576 V/mm, respectively.

TI PREPARATION OF TETRAGONAL PEROVSKITE SINGLE-PHASE PBTIO3 FILM USING AN
   IMPROVED METAL-ORGANIC CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION METHOD ALTERNATELY
   INTRODUCING PB AND TI PRECURSORS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 10TH MEETING OF FERROELECTRIC MATERIALS AND THEIR APPLICATIONS ( FMA-10
   )
CY MAY 26-28, 1993
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
DE FERROELECTRIC THIN FILM; MOCVD; PTO THIN FILM; PZT THIN FILM;
   PEROVSKITE; C-AXIS ORIENTATION
ID THIN-FILMS; GROWTH
AB Perovskite single-phase PbTiO3 films consisting of both a- and c-axis-oriented grains were prepared on a single-crystalline MgO substrate at a low substrate temperature of 510-degrees-C with an improved MOCVD (metal-organic chemical vapor deposition) method using tetra-ethyl-lead, titanium-iso-propoxide and ozone oxidant. Pb and Ti precursor vapors are alternately introduced into the reactor through different inlets, so that complicated vapor-phase reactions between the precursors and the reactions of which were unavoidable in conventional MOCVD, can be significantly inhibited in the inlet manifold. It is probable that this inhibition contributed to the present accomplishment of low-temperature epitaxial growth since it suppresses the vapor-phase generation of various Ti-Pb intermediates and oxides which are considered to greatly impede the flexibility in epitaxy.

TI ELECTROSTATIC FORCE MICROSCOPE IMAGING ANALYZED BY THE SURFACE-CHARGE
   METHOD
SO JOURNAL OF VACUUM SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY B
LA English
DT Article
ID LOCALIZED CHARGE; POTENTIOMETRY; RESOLUTION; INTERFEROMETER; SCALE
AB The electrostatic force acting between the probe of the force microscope and the sample surface is theoretically investigated by using the surface charge method. The actual shapes of the probe (an etched tungsten wire) and the sample (gratinglike electrodes) which are used in the experiments are considered to calculate the electrostatic forces quantitatively. It is shown that the macroscopic probe has to be taken into account for the force measurement. However, only the top part of the probe is responsive for the measurement of the force gradient. The imaging properties through the detection of the electrostatic force are also investigated experimentally by using the dynamic (ac) mode force microscope. The potentiometric and topographic effects on the imaging are discussed on the basis of theoretical calculations and the experimental results.

TI HIGH-FIELD MAGNETIZATION OF NDCO5 AND NDCO5H3 SINGLE-CRYSTALS
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
AB High-field magnetization has been measured for single-crystalline NdCo5 and NdCo5H3 for 4.2 K up to 40 T. NdCo5 is a highly anisotropic collinear ferromagnet with the easy direction of magnetization along the a-axis in the basal plane. It exhibits a first-order spin-orientation transition to the applied field direction along the hard direction (c-axis) at about 35 T with hysteresis. In NdCo5H3 the easy direction deviates from the basal plane. The magnetic stricture becomes noncollinear due to the significant weakening of the Nd-Co intersublattice exchange interaction in the hydride. The Co moment becomes lower by about 25% than that in the parent compound.

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF LUFE10-XALXSI2 QUASI-TERNARIES COMPARED WITH
   UFE10-XALXSI2
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
ID ANISOTROPY
AB LuFe10-xAlxSi2 solid solutions have been studied by means of X-ray analysis, a.c. susceptibility and magnetization measurements. The homogeneity range is found up to x=3. With increasing Al content the lattice parameters increase whereas the magnetic moment, Curie temperature and uniaxial magnetic anisotropy decrease monotonously. The lack of change in the anisotropy type which has been observed in UFe10-xAlxSi2 shows that the origin of this phenomenon in the latter system should not be attributed to the competition in the magnetic anisotropy between the 8i and 8f iron sublattices but to a change in the electronic state of uranium.

TI FABRICATION OF YBA2CU3O7-X-PRBA2CU3O7-Y HETEROSTRUCTURE BY USING A
   HOLLOW-CATHODE DISCHARGE SPUTTERING SYSTEM
SO IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON ELECTRONICS
LA English
DT Article
DE YBCO; CRITICAL TEMPERATURE; HETEROSTRUCTURE; HOLLOW CATHODE EFFECT; DC
   SPUTTERING
AB A sputtering system using dc hollow cathode discharge was developed for the propose of high Tc superconducting devices. Using this system, as-grown superconducting thin films of YBCO have been formed on MgO and SrTiO3 substrates. Influence of the sputtering conditions such as the substrate temperature and discharge gas pressure on the T(c) and lattice parameter was investigated. It was found that superconducting films on MgO with T(c.zero) higher than 87 K were routinely obtained at the pressure of 820 mTorr (5%O2) and substrate temperature of 700-degrees-C during deposition. The a/b-axis and c-axis oriented YBCO-PBCO hetero-structures were also successfully formed on MgO and SrTiO3 substrates.

TI CONTROL OF FLUOROCARBON RADICALS BY ON-OFF MODULATED
   ELECTRON-CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE PLASMA
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE ELECTRON CYCLOTRON RESONANCE PLASMA; INFRARED DIODE LASER ABSORPTION
   SPECTROSCOPY; CHF3; CF; CF2; CF3; RADICAL DENSITY; ON-OFF MODULATED
   PLASMA; FLUOROCARBON FILM
ID LASER-INDUCED FLUORESCENCE; DEPOSITION; SPECTROSCOPY; SELECTIVITY;
   DISCHARGES; MECHANISMS; BAND
AB The CF, CF2 and CF3 radical densities were investigated using infrared diode laser absorption spectroscopy (IRLAS) in a CHF3 electron cyclotron resonance (ECR) plasma with varying on-off period of the microwave source, as well as continuous wave (CW). The ratio of CF and CF2 radical densities to CF3 radical density was successfully controlled through variation of the duty cycle in a constant pulse width, together with the deposition rate of fluorocarbon films. Furthermore, the radical densities were discussed in comparison with intensities of emission lines F*, Ar* and H(alpha).

TI PREPARATION OF IRIDIUM AND PLATINUM FILMS BY MOCVD AND THEIR PROPERTIES
SO JOURNAL DE PHYSIQUE IV
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9TH EUROPEAN CONF ON CHEMICAL VAPOUR DEPOSITION ( EURO CVD 9 )
CY AUG 22-27, 1993
CL TAMPERE, FINLAND
SP AMER SOC MET INT, CITY TAMPERE, INT SCI FDN, TAMPERE UNIV TECHNOL
AB Noble metals (Ir, Pt) films were prepared by MOCVD using metal-acetylacetonate precursors. The effects of deposition conditions on deposition rates, composition and microstructure were studied, and the optimum conditions were determined. A small amount of oxygen addition to the source gas was effective to prepare high-purity films.  Epitaxially grown films were obtained on several kinds of single crystalline substrates.  Black-colored powdery films containing impurity carbon were prepared without oxygen addition. These black films consists of fine particles about several nanometer in size.  Ir films prepared without oxygen addition showed superior electrical and catalytic properties as an electrode for zirconia solid electrolytes particularly below 600-degrees-C.

TI MAGNETIC-BEHAVIOR OF GAMMA-PHASE HYDRIDES RCO3H-SIMILAR-TO-4 IN HIGH

SO PHYSICA B

DT Article
ID CO COMPOUNDS
AB High-field magnetization measurements have been carried out for single-crystal gamma-phase hydrides RCo3H(approximately 4) with R = Th and Dy and for powder samples with R = Nd and Gd. The results indicate that these gamma-phase hydrides with R = Y, Ho and Er become antiferromagnetic except for R = Gd at low temperatures due to the appearance of a negative Co-Co intersublattice interaction. A metamagnetic transition of the Co-sublattice magnetization occurs from the antiferromagnetic to the forced ferromagnetic state if the field is applied along the c-axis. GdCo3H(approximately 4), being ferrimagnetic at low temperatures, becomes antiferromagnetic above 32 K. The significant weakening of the R-Co interaction due to hydrogenation leads to a Neel temperature of about 200 K in all hydrides and an almost independent behaviour of the R and Co sublattices in the compounds with R = Nd, Ho and Er. The role of the R-Co interaction in the magnetic behaviour of the hydrides is discussed.
C1 YOKOHAMA NATL UNIV,FAC ENGN,YOKOHAMA,JAPAN.
RP BARTASHEVICH, MI (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI A CONSTRUCTION OF A SUBSPACE IN EUCLIDEAN-SPACE WITH DESIGNATED VALUES
   OF DIMENSION AND METRIC DIMENSION
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE AMERICAN MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY
LA English
DT Article
DE DIMENSION; METRIC DIMENSION; EUCLIDEAN SPACE; NOBELING SPACE
AB For every integer m, k, and n such that 0 less-than-or-equal-to m less-than-or-equal-to n - 1 and m less-than-or-equal-to k less-than-or-equal-to min{2m, n - 1}, we construct a subspace S(m,k)n in Euclidean n-space R(n) satisfying the conditions that mudim S(m,k)n = m and dim S(m,k)n = k, where mu dim denotes the metric dimension.

AU GOTO, T
   SHINZATO, M
AF GOTO, T
   SHINZATO, M
TI PARTIAL MELTING OF SOLUTION-SPUN (Y,HO)1BA2CU3OX FILAMENT
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID SUPERCONDUCTOR
AB Partial melting of solution-spun (Y, Ho)1Ba2Cu3Ox filament is examined in order to enhance the reproducibility of the high J(c) of the filament. The precursor filament was prepared by solution spinning through a homogeneous aqueous solution containing mixed acetates of Y, Ho, Ba and Cu, polyvinyl alcohol and organic acids. The substitution of Ho lowered the optimum partial-melted temperature to 1010-degrees-C. A high J(cT) value of more than 10(4) A/cm2 at 77 K, 0 T that was reproducible appeared for the partially melted filament by applying a cooling rate of 40-degrees-C/h without the temperature gradient and without additional oxygenation. A maximum J(cT) value of 78 000 A/cm2 at 77 K, 0 T was attained for the Y0.75Ho0.25Ba2Cu3Ox filament. The microstructure presented in the filament is discussed as compared with the melt-textured bulk 123 superconductor.
RP GOTO, T (reprint author), NAGOYA INST TECHNOL,DEPT MAT SCI & ENGN,GOKISO CHO,SHOWA KU,NAGOYA,AICHI 466,JAPAN.

TI INFLUENCE OF SPUTTERING CONDITIONS ON THE CHARACTERISTICS OF
   SUPERCONDUCTING Y-BA-CU-O FILMS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE HIGH-T(C) SUPERCONDUCTOR; IN-SITU-GROWN SUPERCONDUCTING THIN FILM;
   Y-BA-CU-O; RF MAGNETRON SPUTTER; SUBSTRATE HOLDER BIAS; STOICHIOMETRIC
   TARGET
ID THIN-FILMS; MAGNETRON; INSITU; TARGET; YBA2CU3O7
AB Influences of the substrate holder bias voltage V(H), the oxygen partial pressure P(O2), and the distance D between the substrate and the target on the superconducting characteristics of Y-Ba-Cu-O thin films were investigated. The optimum bias voltages were from -10 V to -20 V for total gas pressure P = 300-500 mTorr. With increasing distance at P = 500 mTorr, the critical temperature T(c) increased and the c-lattice parameter co decreased. However, at D longer than 50 mm, the values of T(c) and c0 did not depend on D. These films have the maximum T(c) of 90 K and the c-lattice parameter ranging from 1.167 to 1.169 nm. These results imply that the sputtering conditions of P(O2) greater-than-or-equal-to 300 mTorr, V(H) of -10 V to -20 V and D>5 cm at 500 mTorr are necessary for fabricating the films having T(c) of 87-90 K by means of on-axis rf magnetron sputtering having a YBa2Cu3Oz target.
RP KOBAYASHI, T (reprint author), UNIV ELECTROCOMMUN,DEPT COMMUN & SYST,1-5-1 CHOFUGAOKA,CHOFU,TOKYO 182,JAPAN.

TI STRUCTURE, MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES AND THE FE-57 MOSSBAUER-EFFECT IN THE
   LUFE11-XALXTI SYSTEM
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article
ID EARTH
AB The structure, magnetic properties and the Fe-57 Mossbauer effect of LuFe11-xAlxTi alloys were investigated in the temperature range of 4.2-500 K. The system exists as a single phase for the x < 4 concentration range. The lattice parameters follow Vegard's law. It has been found that these alloys are ferromagnetic with Curie points and magnetic moments decreasing with an increase in Al concentration, x.  The Fe atoms are substituted by the Al atoms mostly in the 8(i) positions and a diminution of hyperfine interaction results from a decrease in the average number of the nearest neighboring Fe atoms.

TI PREDICTION OF THE ABILITY TO PURGE CLONOGENIC-B CELL LYMPHOMA FROM
   NORMAL BM INVITRO BY HEAT - THEIR SURVIVAL CURVES CORRESPOND TO A CURVE
   REFLECTING MORTALITY IN HUMANS
SO BONE MARROW TRANSPLANTATION
LA English
DT Article
ID BONE-MARROW TRANSPLANTATION; LEUKEMIC PROGENITOR CELLS;
   NON-HODGKINS-LYMPHOMA; STEM-CELLS; HYPERTHERMIA; SENSITIVITY; MODEL
AB To develop new purging regimens for ABMT the ability to predict potential for purging of tumor cells from BM is important. Since the sensitivity of human B cell lymphoma to hyperthermia is not known, we examined its effect on the growth of B cell lymphoma cell lines (Raji and Daudi) in vitro to evaluate potential for purging clonogenic tumor cells from normal marrow by heat, using a limiting dilution assay to measure log depletion of tumor cells in a 20-fold excess of normal BM. When exposed to heat (42-43-degrees-C) for 120 min, both clonogenic Raji and Daudi cells were dramatically reduced (a 4-to-6 log reduction) with time, whereas at 42-degrees-C over half and at 43-degrees-C 10% of normal granulocyte-macrophage progenitor cells survived for the same time period. This high level of lymphoma cell depletion by heat correlated with that of immunologic and pharmacologic studies. In addition, these survival curves during heating were found to correlate with the Gompertz-Makeham formula - a law of human mortality. This formula may be useful in predicting the purging effect of heat. These results suggest that in vitro hyperthermia could be applied effectively for the elimination of residual, clonogenic lymphoma cells in autologous marrow grafts before ABMT.
C1 NIIGATA UNIV,SCH MED,DEPT HYG,NIIGATA 951,JAPAN.
RP MORIYAMA, Y (reprint author), NIIGATA UNIV,SCH MED,DEPT INTERNAL MED 1,1-754 ASAHIMACHI,NIIGATA 951,JAPAN.

TI DENSITY-MEASUREMENTS OF EXCITED COMPONENTS IN A LONGITUDINAL DISCHARGE
   EXCIMER-LASER
SO IEEE JOURNAL OF QUANTUM ELECTRONICS
LA English
DT Article
ID PUMPED XECL LASER; ABSORPTION; DYNAMICS
AB Time-dependent particle number densities of the excited components (Xe+*, He*) in a longitudinal discharge XeCl excimer laser were measured by the laser absorption probing with a CW dye laser. The densities were compared with those in transversal discharge XeCl excimer lasers. The formation dynamics of the XeCl excimer molecules, excited atoms, and excited ions were discussed. The dependence of the particle number densities of the Xe+* ions on the buffer gas pressure, the Xe gas pressure, and the HCl gas pressure was investigated.

TI ANALYSIS OF TRANSIENT SPECTRAL SPREAD OF DIRECTLY MODULATED DFB LDS
SO IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
DE OPTICAL COMMUNICATION; OPTOELECTRONICS; DISTRIBUTED FEEDBACK LASER;
   SUBPEAK
AB The transient spectral spread of directly modulated DFB LD's, which appears in the time-resolved chirping measurement, is studied experimentally and numerically. Such a phenomenon has been already reported as a side mode oscillation called ''subpeak'', but there has been little argument as to the physical origin. We make it clear that the subpeak is a spurious mode due to the influence of the photodetector bandwidth. The minimum photodetector bandwidth which is necessary in the time-resolved chirping measurement is examined. Furthermore the distortion of the long-distance transmitted waveform is also explained by one mode oscillation.
RP KAWAI, T (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,FAC ENGN,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI HIGH-FIELD MAGNETIZATION OF ITINERANT-ELECTRON METAMAGNETIC LAVES PHASE
   LU(CO1-XGAX)2 COMPOUNDS
SO SCIENCE REPORTS OF THE RESEARCH INSTITUTES TOHOKU UNIVERSITY SERIES
   A-PHYSICS CHEMISTRY AND METALLURGY
LA English
DT Article
ID COMPOUNDS LU(CO1-XALX)2; SPIN FLUCTUATIONS; YCO2; TRANSITION; LUCO2;
   Y(CO1-XALX)2
AB Nearly ferromagnetic pseudobinary Lu(Co1-xGax)2 compounds have been investigated.  The lattice constant increases with increasing Ga concentration, x, especially above x=0.09.  High field magnetization and magnetoresistance of Lu(Co1-xGax)2 compounds have been measured in static and pulsed magnetic fields.  No significant difference is obtained between the static and pulsed fields. A clear itinerant electron metamagnetic transition is observed and its critical field increases with increasing temperature for x=0.09.  It is suggested from the discussion based on the Clausius-Clapeyron equation that the magnetic entropy of these compounds decreases above the critical field.  This is consistent with the recent result of the electronic specific heat coefficient in the magnetic fields. The magnetoresistance of the ferromagnetic state after the transition is reduced about 30% compared with that of the paramagnetic state.  This means that the metamagnetic transition results in a reduction of the spin fluctuation.

TI LOCALIZATION AND QUANTUM HALL-EFFECT IN 2-DIMENSIONAL SYSTEMS UNDER
   STRONG MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO SCIENCE REPORTS OF THE RESEARCH INSTITUTES TOHOKU UNIVERSITY SERIES
   A-PHYSICS CHEMISTRY AND METALLURGY
LA English
DT Article
ID TWO-DIMENSIONAL SYSTEM; MOS INVERSION-LAYERS; ELECTRON LOCALIZATION;
   LANDAU SUBBANDS; RANGE SCATTERERS; NUMBER 0; BACKSCATTERING; CONTACTS
AB Experimental researches of quantum transport properties of semiconductor two-dimensional electron systems in Si-MOSFETs and GaAs/AlGaAs heterostructures in high magnetic fields up to 27 T and at low temperatures down to 20 mK arc performed. Analysis of the Hall conductivity of Si-MOSFETs based on a mobility edge model shows that the temperature dependence of the mobility edge can not be explained by existing theory of localization. The fractional quantum Hall effect is observed at the filling factor of 1/7 in heterostructures. Sample size dependence and magnetic field dependence of the breakdown of the integral quantum Hall effect in heterostructures reveal that the Hall current is carried not by the edge states but by the extended states in the localization in the bulk of the two-dimensional systems.

TI CONVENTIONAL MAGNETIC-FIELD SENSOR
SO SCIENCE REPORTS OF THE RESEARCH INSTITUTES TOHOKU UNIVERSITY SERIES
   A-PHYSICS CHEMISTRY AND METALLURGY
LA English
DT Article
AB Conventional magnetic field sensors are searched to detect the magnetic field intensity of a superconducting magnet. A fully computerized system with a calibrated GaAs Hall sensor is applied to determine the magnetic field strength in the acoustic dHvA experiments.

TI HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD EFFECTS ON METAL-HYDROGEN CHEMICAL-SYSTEMS
SO SCIENCE REPORTS OF THE RESEARCH INSTITUTES TOHOKU UNIVERSITY SERIES
   A-PHYSICS CHEMISTRY AND METALLURGY
LA English
DT Article
ID FERROMAGNETIC HYDRIDES; EQUILIBRIUM
AB The studies of effects of high magnetic fields on the equilibrium for metal (intermetallic compound)-hydrogen systems have been reviewed. The equilibrium hydrogen pressures for the systems of LaCo5-H, GdCo5-H and Y2Co7-H were measured in magnetic fields up to 15T with a water-cooled magnet (WM-5) and up to 26T with a hybrid magnet (HM-1). The application of magnetic fields causes the hydrogen pressure to increase in LaCo5H4 (50% increase in 26T), whereas it cause the pressure to decrease in GdCo5H2.53 (1.7% decrease in 14T) and the single beta phase of Y2Co7Hx (15% decrease in 14T). These observed changes in the hydrogen pressure agree well qualitatively and quantitatively with the value derived from a thermodynamic theory and magnetic data. It is first found that the potential of the electrochemical system was shifted 1.0mV by a magnetic field of 10T for the LaCo5-H cell.

TI PREPARATION OF INFINITE LAYER OF CA1-XSRXCUO2 FILAMENTS BY SOLUTION
   SPINNING METHOD UNDER AMBIENT PRESSURE
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE INFINITE LAYER; CA1-XSRXCUO2 SOLUTION SPINNING; AMBIENT PRESSURE;
   SUPERCONDUCTING FILAMENT
ID SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
AB Preparation of an infinite layer of Ca1-xSrxCuO2 filaments by solution spinning under ambient pressure was studied. The filament was prepared by dry spinning with a starting homogeneous aqueous solution containing acetates of Ca, Sr and Cu, polyvinyl alcohol and organic acids. Although a single phase of the infinite layer appeared only for the filament with x=0.14, the compositional range for the mixed phase of the infinite layer was expanded to 0.05 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 0.3. Solution spinning lowered the synthetic temperature of the infinite layer by 100-degrees-C.

   GOTO, T
TI DIFFERENTIAL MAGNETIC-SUSCEPTIBILITY OF AMORPHOUS FE-Y ALLOYS
SO JOURNAL OF PHYSICS-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID YTTRIUM-IRON ALLOYS; SPIN-GLASSES; LA ALLOYS; MOSSBAUER; BEHAVIOR;
   TBFE2; YFE2
AB The spin-glass behaviour of amorphous FexY100-x alloys (70 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 90) has been investigated by means of differential magnetic susceptibility dM/dH. In low magnetic fields, the dM/dH versus T curves show the peaks, indicating that the spin-glass state occurs through two steps. Two freezing temperatures are defined from the two peaks in the curve, i.e. the higher temperature is T(g) and the lower temperature is T(f). From the results of the magnetization measurement as a function of temperature, i.e. the M versus T curve, it is indicated that the magnetization starts to decrease at T(g) and a thermal irreversibility appears below T(f) with decreasing temperature.     With increase in the applied magnetic field, a third peak appears at around 150 K in the dM/dH versus T curve for amorphous Fe84Y16 alloy. The position of this peak corresponds to the upper inflection point in the M versus T curve, being defined as the Curie temperature T(C). Therefore, re-entrant behaviour appears in this system on application of a magnetic field. The concentration dependences of T(C) and T(f) for a field of 500 Oe are very similar to those obtained in zero field for other amorphous Fe-RE alloys (RE: rare-earth metal) such as Fe-Lu and Fe-Ce systems.
RP FUJITA, A (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT MAT SCI,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI MEASUREMENTS OF THE CF, CF-2 AND CF-3 RADICALS IN A CHF3
   ELECTRON-CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE PLASMA
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE ELECTRON CYCLOTRON RESONANCE PLASMA; INFRARED DIODE LASER ABSORPTION
   SPECTROSCOPY; CHF3; CF; CF2; CF3; RADICAL DENSITY
ID DIODE-LASER ABSORPTION; RADIO-FREQUENCY PLASMAS; SILANE PLASMA;
   SPECTROSCOPY; MODEL; SIO2
AB The CF, CF2 and CF3 radicals were investigated in an on-off modulated electron cyclotron resonance (ECR) plasma employing a CHF3 gas using infrared diode laser absorption spectroscopy (IRLAS). The microwave power dependences of the radical densities were measured at a CHF3 pressure of 0.4 Pa in the microwave power range from 50 W to 800 W. Moreover, the extinction processes of the radicals were discussed on the basis of the decay curve analysis of the radical densities after termination of the discharge.

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES AND SPONTANEOUS MAGNETOSTRICTION OF A SM2CO7
   SINGLE-CRYSTAL
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article
ID ANISOTROPY; SMCO5
AB The high-field magnetization and the lattice parameters of the intermetallic compound Sm2Co7 have been studied on single-crystal samples in a wide temperature range. The compound is a highly anisotropic ferromagnet having mu(s) = 10.1mu(B)/f.u., T(c) = 670 K and uniaxial magnetic anisotropy above 68 K. Below 68 K, a spontaneous spin reorientation of the axis-cone type occurs and the cone angle reaches 15-degrees at 4.2 K. The Sm atoms on the quasicubic sites are considered to be responsible for the spin reorientation. The magnetic ordering is accompanied by positive spontaneous magnetostrictive strains in the basal plane and along the c axis which reach at 5 K 2.1 x 10(-3) and 3.6 x 10(-3), respectively. That corresponds to a spontaneous volume magnetostriction 7.8 x 10(-3). The spin reorientation is accompanied by an additional negative volume anomaly -0.9 x 10(-3).

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF TB1-XRXFE10SI2 (R = Y, U) SOLID-SOLUTIONS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article
ID ALLOYS; UFE2
AB Tb1-xRxFe10Si2(R = Y, U) solid solutions have been studied by means of X-ray analysis, AC susceptibility and magnetization measurements. TbFe10Si2 undergoes a spin reorientation from basal-plane to a uniaxial type of magnetic anisotropy at 520 K. From the concentration dependences of the spin-reorientation temperature the conclusion has been made that the Th-sublattice contribution to the magnetic anisotropy is one order of magnitude larger (in absolute value) than the Fe and U contributions.

TI ACOUSTIC DE-HAAS-VAN-ALPHEN EFFECT IN LAB6 AND CEB6
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID FERMI-SURFACE
AB The acoustic de Haas-van Alphen effect of the heavy fermion compound CeB6 and the reference system LaB6 has been measured. A pronounced enhancement of the electron-strain interaction in particular regions on the Fermi surface of LaB6 has been found. The spin splitting of the electron pocket in CeB6 has been discussed.

TI ACOUSTIC DE-HAAS-VAN-ALPHEN EFFECT IN LASB AND CESB
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID ANOMALOUS MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; FERMI-SURFACE; MONOPNICTIDES; STATE
AB We have investigated the de Haas-van Alphen effect in LaSb and CeSb by means of an ultrasound velocity measurement. Anisotropic electron-strain interactions on the Fermi surfaces in LaSb were found by the field angle dependence of the oscillatory intensity of the longitudinal C-11 mode. The large and heavy hole beta4, which was predicted by the p-f mixing model, has been found in CeSb. The cyclotron effective mass of beta4, was 4.2m0.

TI MAGNETISM OF R2NI7 AND RNI3 (R = Y, LA, CE)
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The temperature and field dependence of magnetization of R2Ni7 and RNi3 (R = Y, La, Ce) have been measured. It has been revealed that Y2Ni7 and YNi3 show weak ferromagnetism, and that La2Ni7 and LaNi3 show susceptibility peaks and metamagnetic transitions. Such behavior may be connected with the band structure. Ce2Ni7 shows very weak ferromagnetism, and CeNi3 shows Pauli paramagnetism.

TI NUCLEAR MAGNETIC-RELAXATION IN A HEAVY-FERMION COMPOUND YBAS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID MONOPNICTIDES
AB The As-75 nuclear spin-lattice relaxation rate (T1(-1)) of a heavy-fermion compound YbAs has been measured between 0.52 K and 100 K. The relaxation process seems to consist of two components, although As atoms have cubic local symmetry and have no quadrupolar field. The relaxation rate for the shorter T1 decreases gradually below 1.5 K with decreasing temperature. This behavior is quite in contrast to that of YbP, which has a sudden increase at T(N). This difference seems to be consistent with the difference in the temperature dependence of the order parameter between YbAs and YbP.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV, FAC SCI, DEPT PHYS, SENDAI, MIYAGI 980, JAPAN.
RP OYAMADA, A (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV, COLL LIBERAL ARTS & SCI, DEPT PHYS, KYOTO 606, JAPAN.

TI MAGNETOELASTIC INTERACTION OF RARE-EARTH HEXABORIDES
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID PRB6; NDB6; CEB6
AB We have measured the temperature dependences of the various elastic constants of rare earth hexaborides. The characteristic features of the electron-strain interaction relating to the cooperative Jahn-Teller effect of PrB6, NdB6, DyB6, the Kondo effect of CexLa1-xB6 and the valence fluctuating state of SmB6 have been described.

TI SPIN FLUCTUATION AND STATIC PROPERTIES OF THE LOCAL MOMENTS IN THE
   HALDANE-GAP SYSTEM NI(C2H8N2)2NO2(CLO4) STUDIED BY H-1-NMR
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID MONTE-CARLO CALCULATION; QUANTUM ENERGY-GAP; ANTIFERROMAGNET
   NI(C2H8N2)2NO2(CLO4); HEISENBERG-ANTIFERROMAGNET; MAGNETIC-FIELD; CHAIN;
   NENP
AB The nuclear spin-lattice relaxation time T1 of H-1 nuclei in the S = 1 quasi-one-dimensional Heisenberg antiferromagnet Ni(C2H8N2)2NO2(ClO4) (NENP) was measured at temperatures above 1.4 K in the field range below 12 T. The field dependence of the relaxation rate T1(-1) exhibited a maximum at 9.5 T, which corresponds to the critical field, for the field parallel to the chain at low temperatures below 4 K. The experimental results were analyzed by treating the magnetic excitation as free fermions. The H-1 NMR spectra were also measured for various fields and temperatures. The results showed the appearance of static local moments even at fields as low as 3 T. Their temperature and field dependences were explained by considering the mixing of the ground state and the first excited state in the Haldane-gap system.
C1 KYOTO UNIV,COLL LIBERAL ARTS & SCI,DEPT PHYS,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.
RP FUJIWARA, N (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI UPPER-BOUNDS OF SUPERSYMMETRIC PARTICLE MASSES IN A GAUGINO-ORIGINATED
   RADIATIVE BREAKING SCENARIO
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW D
LA English
DT Article
ID LIGHTEST HIGGS BOSON; STANDARD MODEL; DIMENSIONAL REDUCTION; SYMMETRY
   BREAKING; FLIPPED SU(5); Z0 DECAYS; SUPERGRAVITY; SEARCHES; PAIRS; LEP
AB The mass spectrum of supersymmetric particles is studied in the radiative breaking scenario of the minimal supersymmetric standard model, with an assumption that all soft supersymmetry-breaking parameters other than the gaugino masses are vanishing at the Planck scale. The U(1) gaugino mass M1X is taken to be an independent parameter, while the SU(2) and SU(3) gaugino masses are supposed to be unified. Within the ''natural'' range, the whole parameter space is scanned numerically and the consistent particle mass spectra with the experimental bounds are obtained. The supersymmetric particle masses are tightly bounded above as m(e)R less than or similar to 100 GeV, etc., if the top quark is sufficiently heavy m(top) greater than or similar to 100 GeV and the minimal grand unified theory relation for three gaugino masses is satisfied. For a large \M1X\, there is no restriction other than the naturalness for the upper bounds of supersymmetric particle masses.
RP GOTO, T (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI QUALITY EVALUATION ON GREEN TEA
SO SENSORS AND ACTUATORS B-CHEMICAL
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL MEETING ON CHEMICAL SENSORS
CY SEP 13-17, 1992
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN ASSOC CHEM SENSORS, ELECTROCHEM SOC JAPAN, CATALYSIS SOC JAPAN, CERAM SOC JAPAN, CHEM SOC JAPAN, INST ELECT ENGINEERS JAPAN, ION ENGN SOC JAPAN, IRON & STEEL INST JAPAN, JAPAN INST MET, JAPAN SOC ANAL CHEM
AB For the purpose of the objective quality evaluation of Japanese green tea (Sencha), chemical sensors have been introduced. An enzyme electrode, which consists of an oxygen electrode and a biocatalytic membrane containing L-amino acid oxidase, is used to measure amino-acid concentrations in tea infusions. The values determined by this method are highly correlated to the values determined by the conventional colorimetric method. Since high-grade teas show high total amino-acid values, this enzyme electrode can be used for the practical quality evaluation of green tea. The aroma of green tea delicately reflects quality deterioration. An odorant sensor is used for a simple analysis of the aroma of tea leaves. Teas with bad aroma, judged from sensory tests, show higher odor values than teas of normal aroma with this sensor.
C1 SHIZUOKA SEIKI CO LTD,FUKUROI 437,JAPAN.
RP HORIE, H (reprint author), NATL RES INST VEGETABLES,ORNAMENTAL PLANTS & TEA,2769 KANAYA,SHIZUOKA 428,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETOREFLECTION OF THE LOWEST EXCITON IN A LAYERED PEROVSKITE-TYPE
   COMPOUND (C10H21NH3)2PBI4
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS; 40-T
AB Magnetoreflection spectra in the Faraday configuration have been investigated up to 40 T at 4.2K for a single crystal of (C10H21NH3)2PbI4, which consists of two-dimensional networks of corner-sharing octahedra [PbI6]4-. The Zeeman shift is observed, and the effective g-factor is 1.42+/-0.04. The observed diamagnetic shift of the lowest exciton is (7 +/- 4) x 10(-8)eV/T2, from which the two-dimensional Bohr radius is estimated to be 7 angstrom at most. It suggests that the exciton wave function extends only to the 4 nearest neighbor octahedra [PbI6]4-in the two-dimensional layer. By referring to the resonant Raman scattering spectra and reflection spectra of strained single crystals, a few narrow dips in high reflectivity region of the lowest exciton are ascribed to the vibronic excitons.
